(A) Geographical Index ............ . 57* (B) Index of Published Inscriptions commented on in the Journal of Hellenic Studies .............59*</page><page sequence="41">NOTE.-In the INDEX OF CLASSICAL AUTHORS only those passages are inserted of which the interpretation is discussed, or in which a new reading is proposed. Passages merely cited in illustration are omitted. In the INDEX OF SUBJECTS, places of which the coin-types are discussed are collected under the heading ' Coins.' Articles dealing with the inscriptions of whole districts are indexed (1) under the names of those districts, in the INDEX OF SUBJECTS; (2) in the EPIGRAPHIC INDEX (A) under the names of the sites from which the inscriptions come.</page><page sequence="42">INDEX I.-INDEX OF AUTHORS ALLEN, T. Tr ;--vV'. xiv. 354 . x. 225-228</page><page sequence="97">Ube !iocietp for the p3romotion of Ibellentc itubLte THE JOURNAL OF HELLENIC STUDIES INDEX TO VOLUMES XVI[.-XLII. AND TO SUPPLEMENTARY PAPER III. PUBLISHED BY TIIE COUNCIL, AND SOLD ON THEIR BEHALF BY MACMILLAN AND CO., LIMITED, ST. MARTIN'S STREET LONDON, W.C. 2 MC.MXXIII</page><page sequence="98">CONTENTS PREFACE .. .. . . . .. 4 I. INDEX OF AUTHORS . . . . . . . 5 II. INDEX OF SUBJECTS . . . . . 17 III. GREEK INDEX . . . . . . . . . . 84 IV. NUMISMATIC INDEX . . . . . . . . . 92 V. EPI(GRAPHIC INDICES- A. (GEOGRAPHICAL INDEX . . . . . . . 95 B. INDEX OF PUBLISI[ED INSCRIPITIONS, IIEPUBIISHEI) EIMENDED OR DISCUSSED IN TIIFE JOURNAL OF HELLENIC STUIDIES . . . . . . 100 7*</page><page sequence="99">PREFACE THE present Index is the work of several hands, during a considerable number of years, and any inequalities of treatment that may be found in it must beg to be excused on that account. It is based on the annual Indices which were issued with each volume, being the work of the business Editor of the day. Mr. G. F. Hill drew up the Indices for volumes XVII-XXXT and during the war period, while Mr. E. J. Forsdyke was responsible for the rest. The primary combined alphabetising of these annual Indices was executed by Mrs. A. H. Smith. This has been much added to, revised and rewritten by myself. In particular, the volumes have been re-read for the Museo- graphic references, and for the Numismatic and Epigraphic Indices. The proofs have been read by eight nmembers of the Council-namely Messrs. E. Norman Gardiner, E. A. Gardner, G. F. Hill, Miss C. A. Hutton, Messrs. H. M. Last, F. H. Marshall, F. N. Pryce, and H. B. Walters. Each collaborator undertook the verification and scrutiny of the entries relating to certain assigned volumes, and their corrections have been combined by myself. The Greek Index is the work of Messrs. Forsdyke and Pryce. The Index of Authors is by Miss E. Dawes. The principal new feature in the present Index is the attempt to distinguish between incidental references and references to complete articles. Entries of the latter kind are indicated by Clarendon type, followed by the author's name in brackets. Spellings are not always consistent with each other or with the texts referred to. In general they are brought into accordance with the Society's editorial scheme of spelling, printed in most volumes of the Journal. A. H. SMITH. ])ecember 31, 1923.</page><page sequence="100">INDEX INDEX OF AUTHORS ALBIZZATI, C.- Two Ivory Fragments of a Statue of Athena, 36, 373 ALLEN, T.
